channel.title: Pathfinding algorithm [JAVA]
channel.description: I have been writing my own pathfinding algorithm, for I am making my own game engine. Any suggestions? Yes this is 2d. I have been thinking of using Dijkstra's algorithm for it. However there are many ways.

item.title: Pathfinding algorithm [JAVA]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:3, topic:421806”]Although I would like that. It appears (Havn’t looked to in-depth at it) to be using a rpg already. Did you actually use those imports for anything? Davidtheinsley is you so… I assume the is yours.[/quote]Constants is just used for the region size variable, and Path is literally just a queue for step variables

http://code.google.com/p/unnamed-rpg/source/browse/trunk/RPG/src/server/game/entity/character/utils/Path.java
http://code.google.com/p/unnamed-rpg/source/browse/trunk/RPG/src/server/game/Constants.java

Read full topic

item.title: Pathfinding algorithm [JAVA]
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Since all the edges on your network will have a positive weight, dijkstra’s will do fine.
This looks like a good implementation (it relies on this class as mentioned in the comments).

I think the harder part of path finding is identifying key “locations” where you can position the nodes of your network.

Read full topic
